subject: Re: [junit] 5 Open Source Java projects with "sufficient" JUnit tests?
msgSnippet: JDepend and JUnitPerf both ship with unit tests: http://clarkware.com/software/JDepend.html http://clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html I can t say I ve ever
messageBody:
JDepend and JUnitPerf both ship with unit tests:

http://clarkware.com/software/JDepend.html
http://clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html

I can't say I've ever run a code coverage tool on either of these
projects.

Brian Marick has written extensively on the perils of reading too much
into code coverage. In particular, you'll want to read "How to Misuse
Code Coverage":

http://www.testing.com/writings/coverage.pdf

Mike

On Sep 24, 2004, at 8:40 AM, Harald Mueller wrote:

> Hi -
> for trying out what coverage means (first, for me ... then maybe for
> us?)
> with unit testing (with various tools, among others my [not yet public]
> addition of "hansel categories" of Hansel), I would like to have
> around 5
> not-too-small (say >= 50 classes, >= a few 100 methods) open source
> with
> "good" unit tests.
> I started wading through Sourceforge, but it's quite tedious ... If
> someone
> can me point to such projects, that would be really nice!
> Thanks
> Harald M. Mueller
>
> --
